meanings.sent1: The pressed grapes made delicious juice.
meanings.sent2: The students sat on the pressed grass during the picnic.
meanings.sent3: The pressed clothes in the suitcase looked neat and tidy.
meanings.sent4: The pressed snow formed a solid ice block.
meanings.sent5: The pressed clay created a strong sculpture.

meanings.sent1: She pressed him to finish his homework before dinner.
meanings.sent2: The coach pressed the team to give their best performance.
meanings.sent3: The deadline pressed her to complete the project quickly.
meanings.sent4: The urgent situation pressed them to make a decision.
meanings.sent5: The responsibility pressed on his shoulders heavily.

meanings.sent1: The pressed book had beautiful illustrations.
meanings.sent2: The pressed newspaper contained the latest news.
meanings.sent3: The pressed magazine cover caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent4: The pressed document was distributed to all employees.
meanings.sent5: The pressed poster was displayed on the bulletin board.

meanings.sent1: Her pressed shirt looked crisp and neat.
meanings.sent2: The pressed pants had no wrinkles at all.
meanings.sent3: The pressed tablecloth was perfect for the dinner party.
meanings.sent4: The pressed curtains hung elegantly in the living room.
meanings.sent5: The pressed fabric felt smooth to the touch.
